page.title: 16The Black Horse, Bean
page.content: { }The Black Horse public house, once The Black Horse and Fruit Cart Inn, stands in Bean High Street. The landlord has been nominated Publican of the Year for 1985 by a press group. A meeting place for locals, the pub also caters for regulars from outside the village who come to enjoy the real ale and pub food. From a set menu, the most expensive item is a 16 oz. T-bone steak served with vegetables for Â£6.75 with perhaps apple pie and cream to follow at 90p. An added attraction is the garden where barbecues are held at weekends during the summer. A pets' corner keeps the children amused. Once a week the customers are entertained by a blind young man who sings and plays the guitar.
